In the beginning<S>7225</S> of the reign<S>4467</S> of Jehoiakim<S>3079</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Josiah<S>2977</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> came this word<S>1697</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S> from the LORD<S>3068</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> to me; Make<S>6213</S> thee bonds<S>4147</S> and yokes<S>4133</S>, and put<S>5414</S> them upon thy neck<S>6677</S>, <sup>saith: or, hath the LORD said</sup>
And send<S>7971</S> them to the king<S>4428</S> of Edom<S>123</S>, and to the king<S>4428</S> of Moab<S>4124</S>, and to the king<S>4428</S> of the Ammonites<S>1121</S> <S>5983</S>, and to the king<S>4428</S> of Tyrus<S>6865</S>, and to the king<S>4428</S> of Zidon<S>6721</S>, by the hand<S>3027</S> of the messengers<S>4397</S> which come<S>935</S> to Jerusalem<S>3389</S> unto Zedekiah<S>6667</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>;
And command<S>6680</S> them to say<S>559</S> unto their masters<S>113</S>, Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, the God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>; Thus shall ye say<S>559</S> unto your masters<S>113</S>; <sup>to say: or, concerning their masters, saying</sup>
I have made<S>6213</S> the earth<S>776</S>, the man<S>120</S> and the beast<S>929</S> that are upon<S>6440</S> the ground<S>776</S>, by my great<S>1419</S> power<S>3581</S> and by my outstretched<S>5186</S> arm<S>2220</S>, and have given<S>5414</S> it unto whom it seemed<S>5869</S> meet<S>3474</S> unto me.
And now have I given<S>5414</S> all these lands<S>776</S> into the hand<S>3027</S> of Nebuchadnezzar<S>5019</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, my servant<S>5650</S>; and the beasts<S>2416</S> of the field<S>7704</S> have I given<S>5414</S> him also to serve<S>5647</S> him.
And all nations<S>1471</S> shall serve<S>5647</S> him, and his son<S>1121</S>, and his son's<S>1121</S> son<S>1121</S>, until the very time<S>6256</S> of his land<S>776</S> come<S>935</S>: and then many<S>7227</S> nations<S>1471</S> and great<S>1419</S> kings<S>4428</S> shall serve<S>5647</S> themselves of him.
And it shall come to pass, that the nation<S>1471</S> and kingdom<S>4467</S> which will not serve<S>5647</S> the same Nebuchadnezzar<S>5019</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, and that will not put<S>5414</S> their neck<S>6677</S> under the yoke<S>5923</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, that nation<S>1471</S> will I punish<S>6485</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, with the sword<S>2719</S>, and with the famine<S>7458</S>, and with the pestilence<S>1698</S>, until I have consumed<S>8552</S> them by his hand<S>3027</S>.
Therefore hearken<S>8085</S> not ye to your prophets<S>5030</S>, nor to your diviners<S>7080</S>, nor to your dreamers<S>2472</S>, nor to your enchanters<S>6049</S>, nor to your sorcerers<S>3786</S>, which speak<S>559</S> unto you, saying<S>559</S>, Ye shall not serve<S>5647</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>: <sup>dreamers: Heb. dreams</sup>
For they prophesy<S>5012</S> a lie<S>8267</S> unto you, to remove you far<S>7368</S> from your land<S>127</S>; and that I should drive you out<S>5080</S>, and ye should perish<S>6</S>.
But the nations<S>1471</S> that bring<S>935</S> their neck<S>6677</S> under the yoke<S>5923</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, and serve<S>5647</S> him, those will I let remain still<S>3240</S> in their own land<S>127</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; and they shall till<S>5647</S> it, and dwell<S>3427</S> therein.
I spake<S>1696</S> also to Zedekiah<S>6667</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> according to all these words<S>1697</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Bring<S>935</S> your necks<S>6677</S> under the yoke<S>5923</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, and serve<S>5647</S> him and his people<S>5971</S>, and live<S>2421</S>.
Why will ye die<S>4191</S>, thou and thy people<S>5971</S>, by the sword<S>2719</S>, by the famine<S>7458</S>, and by the pestilence<S>1698</S>, as the LORD<S>3068</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S> against the nation<S>1471</S> that will not serve<S>5647</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>?
Therefore hearken<S>8085</S> not unto the words<S>1697</S> of the prophets<S>5030</S> that speak<S>559</S> unto you, saying<S>559</S>, Ye shall not serve<S>5647</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>: for they prophesy<S>5012</S> a lie<S>8267</S> unto you.
For I have not sent<S>7971</S> them, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, yet they prophesy<S>5012</S> a lie<S>8267</S> in my name<S>8034</S>; that I might drive you out<S>5080</S>, and that ye might perish<S>6</S>, ye, and the prophets<S>5030</S> that prophesy<S>5012</S> unto you. <sup>a lie: Heb. in a lie, or, lyingly</sup>
Also I spake<S>1696</S> to the priests<S>3548</S> and to all this people<S>5971</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; Hearken<S>8085</S> not to the words<S>1697</S> of your prophets<S>5030</S> that prophesy<S>5012</S> unto you, saying<S>559</S>, Behold, the vessels<S>3627</S> of the LORD'S<S>3068</S> house<S>1004</S> shall now shortly<S>4120</S> be brought again<S>7725</S> from Babylon<S>894</S>: for they prophesy<S>5012</S> a lie<S>8267</S> unto you.
Hearken<S>8085</S> not unto them; serve<S>5647</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>, and live<S>2421</S>: wherefore should this city<S>5892</S> be laid waste<S>2723</S>?
But if they be prophets<S>5030</S>, and if the word<S>1697</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> be<S>3426</S> with them, let them now make intercession<S>6293</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, that the vessels<S>3627</S> which are left<S>3498</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, and in the house<S>1004</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>, and at Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, go<S>935</S> not to Babylon<S>894</S>.
For thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S> concerning the pillars<S>5982</S>, and concerning the sea<S>3220</S>, and concerning the bases<S>4350</S>, and concerning the residue<S>3499</S> of the vessels<S>3627</S> that remain<S>3498</S> in this city<S>5892</S>,
Which Nebuchadnezzar<S>5019</S> king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S> took<S>3947</S> not, when he carried away captive<S>1540</S> Jeconiah<S>3204</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Jehoiakim<S>3079</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> from Jerusalem<S>3389</S> to Babylon<S>894</S>, and all the nobles<S>2715</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> and Jerusalem<S>3389</S>;
Yea, thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, the God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, concerning the vessels<S>3627</S> that remain<S>3498</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, and in the house<S>1004</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> and of Jerusalem<S>3389</S>;
They shall be carried<S>935</S> to Babylon<S>894</S>, and there shall they be until the day<S>3117</S> that I visit<S>6485</S> them, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; then will I bring<S>5927</S> them up, and restore<S>7725</S> them to this place<S>4725</S>.
